personal-dashboard-policies-guidelines-b: Check what is acceptable and expected on Wikipedia.
personal-dashboard-policies-guidelines-m: Review best practices to create a free and reliable encyclopedia.
personal-dashboard-policies-guidelines-n: Content must represent significant views fairly, proportionately, and without bias.
The New York Yankees are the best baseball team in history.
This is an opinion that can’t be supported by reliable sources. Instead you could write “The New York Yankees have won 26 World Series championships — almost three times as many as any other team”.
William Shakespeare is widely considered to be one of the greatest authors in the English language.
This is a proper definition of a reputation. It is only valid because many reliable sources have stated that Shakespeare has this reputation.
Articles should summarise published sources, and not contain users’ own interpretation or knowledge.
The temperature is hotter in November this year compared to last year.
The claim doesn’t have any reliable and related source material supporting it.
People who listen to music can feel less stressed [reliable source]. Lower stress is linked to living longer [reliable source]. Therefore, listening to music increases how long you live.
Material from multiple sources should not be combined to state or imply a conclusion that is not explicitly stated by any of the sources.
personal-dashboard-policies-guidelines-v: New additions should include a citation, providing the source of the information.

Breaking-news reports often contain inaccuracies. It is better to wait a day or two after an event before adding details to Wikipedia. This gives journalists time to collect more information and for investigative authorities to make official announcements.
Content from social media is largely not acceptable. It may be considered if published by an established subject-matter expert.
Content from trusted academic journals or books.
Content should be sourced to reliable, independent, published sources with a reputation for fact-checking and accuracy.
personal-dashboard-policies-guidelines-a: Remember that most users are trying to improve Wikipedia and not deliberately reduce its quality.
“I can’t believe you messed up my page by not formatting your edit properly, stop editing Wikipedia!”
Avoid accusing editors of acting in bad faith when they made a mistake.
“I noticed that you didn’t get the formatting quite right in your edit. I’ve fixed it for you, and this help page might help you next time.”
Unless there is clear evidence of bad faith, help each other improve the articles quality.
